articles.description: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz produces a dominant display to sweep past Tommy Paul in straight sets and reach the French Open semi-finals, where he will meet Lorenzo Musetti.
articles.title: French Open 2025 results: Carlos Alcaraz sets up semi-final meeting with Lorenzo Musetti

articles.description: Jamie Smith's promotion to England opener may have surprised some but it was the obvious move for Bazball's favourite son.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Jamie Smith shows the method to hosts thinking

articles.description: England attacking midfielder Fran Kirby retires from international football with immediate effect after being told she will not be in the Euro 2025 squad.
articles.title: Fran Kirby: Lionesses star retires from England duty before Euro 2025

articles.description: India legend Virat Kohli finally wins the Indian Premier League as Royal Challengers sealed their maiden title with a six-run win over Punjab Kings.
articles.title: IPL 2025 results: Virat Kohli and RCB win first title after 18 years

articles.description: Big-name retirements, an impressive display against Portugal but dominated by Spain days later. Has it been a positive week for England or a reality check before this summer's Euros?
articles.title: 'Very good week' for Lionesses or 'back to the drawing board'?

articles.description: Inter Milan and manager Simone Inzaghi part company in the wake of the Champions League final thrashing by Paris St-Germain.
articles.title: Inter Milan: Simone Inzaghi leaves as manager

articles.description: As Manchester United start talks with Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo, BBC Sport's Simon Stone takes a closer look at the club's transfer strategy this summer.
articles.title: What is Manchester United's transfer strategy? Bryan Mbeumo, Matheus Cunha and Bruno Fernandes

articles.description: World Boxing apologises for naming Olympic champion Imane Khelif in the governing body's announcement of mandatory sex testing.
articles.title: Imane Khelif: World Boxing apologises for naming Algerian fighter in sex test announcement

articles.description: Brentford sign keeper Caoimhin Kelleher from Liverpool to replace Netherlands stopper Mark Flekken, who leaves the Bees to join Bayer Leverkusen.
articles.title: Brentford sign Liverpool's Caoimhin Kelleher as Mark Flekken is sold to Bayer Leverkusen

articles.description: World Aquatics becomes the first international federation to ban anyone, which includes athletes and coaches, taking part in the controversial Enhanced Games.
articles.title: World Aquatics to ban those who take part in Enhanced Games
